FuncDef:
The aaa abnormal-offline-record hiden command configures the unexpected logout reason as the user's request to go offline in a RADIUS packet.
The undo aaa abnormal-offline-record hiden command restores the default configuration.
By default, the system is configured to record abnormal logout events.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a start ID of the unexpected logout reason.
The value is an integer ranging from 2 to 18.

Specifies an end ID of the unexpected logout reason.
The value is an integer ranging from 3 to 18.
The above is the supported range of values. The actual range of values varies with the value of the startId configuration. The range of values is from (startId + 1) to 18.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After the unexpected logout recording function is enabled, the system records unexpected logout events, which helps management and fault locating.If a network administrator regards some recorded unexpected logout events as normal, run the aaa abnormal-offline-record hiden command to configure the unexpected logout reason as the user's request to go offline in a RADIUS packet.
